flounder.shaders

Class UniformVec4

  • java.lang.Object
    • flounder.shaders.Uniform
      • flounder.shaders.UniformVec4

  • public class UniformVec4
extends Uniform
    Represents a 4 value vector uniform type that can be loaded to the shader.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UniformVec4(java.lang.String name) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void loadVec4(Colour colour)
      Loads a Colour to the uniform if the value already on the GPU is not the same as the new value.
      void loadVec4(float x, float y, float z, float w)
      Loads a x, y, z and w value to the uniform if the value already on the GPU is not the same as the new value.
      void loadVec4(Vector4f vector)
      Loads a Vector4f to the uniform if the value already on the GPU is not the same as the new value.

      • Methods inherited from class flounder.shaders.Uniform

        getLocation, storeUniformLocation

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • loadVec4

        public void loadVec4(Vector4f vector)
        Loads a Vector4f to the uniform if the value already on the GPU is not the same as the new value.
        Parameters:
        vector - The new vector.

      • loadVec4

        public void loadVec4(float x,
                     float y,
                     float z,
                     float w)
        Loads a x, y, z and w value to the uniform if the value already on the GPU is not the same as the new value.
        Parameters:
        x - The new x value.
        y - The new y value.
        z - The new z value.
        w - The new w value.

      • loadVec4

        public void loadVec4(Colour colour)
        Loads a Colour to the uniform if the value already on the GPU is not the same as the new value.
        Parameters:
        colour - The new colour.
